node.title: Entering the 'red zone' - A look inside an Auckland Covid-19 ward
node.description: Checkpoint reporter Louise Ternouth and camera operator Marika Khabazi head into the red zone and talk to those at the frontline about their challenges and hopes. Audio

node.title: Daunte Wright was "just gasping" after shooting, girlfriend testifies
node.description: The woman who was riding with Daunte Wright​ when he was pulled over by police testified about the chaos right after an officer shot him.

node.title: What Your Microwave Can Do for You
node.description: After years without one, I’m learning to love this appliance.

node.title: Volkswagen’s C.E.O. stays on board, but loses some responsibilities.
node.description: Herbert Diess, who angered workers by mentioning the possibility of job cuts, will hand over some authority to a deputy.

node.title: A Surge in Trading Preceded Trump’s SPAC Deal
node.description: Trading in the merger partner’s warrants, which allow holders to buy shares later, spiked several times before the Trump Media agreement was made public.

node.title: No More 99 Cent Pizza: Why Washington Is Getting Worried About Inflation
node.description: Price gains have moved up sharply for months, but the fact that the trend is lasting and broadening has newly put policymakers on red alert.

node.title: Danish Leader Is Questioned Over ‘Minkgate’ Cull Driven by Covid Fears
node.description: The prime minister, Mette Frederiksen, said she did not know the government lacked legal authority to order the mass slaughter of 17 million minks after infected animals passed the virus to humans.

node.title: Austria to Implement Vaccine Register, Fine Unvaccinated Residents Up to $4000
node.description: Austria will begin its general vaccine mandate on February 1, registering all vaccinated and vaccine-exempt residents and fining people who do not comply.

node.title: 102 Journalists Imprisoned in China in 2021, International Group Says
node.description: 365 journalists are behind bars across the world according to the report from The International Federation of Journalists.

node.title: Kiwibank faces court action as home loan customers overcharged
node.description: The Financial Markets Authority has filed High Court civil proceedings against Kiwibank over false or misleading representations over fee waivers.

node.title: Ordering holiday gifts? Check these top retailers' deadlines
node.description: From Amazon to Walmart, here are big retailers' guidelines for getting your gifts on time this season.

node.title: Kim Abeles Turns the Climate Crisis Into Eco-art
node.description: She doesn’t just make art about pollution, she makes art out of it. Now her “Smog Collectors” series is on view at California State University, Fullerton.

node.title: Fox News Christmas Tree Arson Suspect Craig Tamanaha Free on No Bail Hours After Arrest
node.description: The changes were implemented in January 2020, preventing cash bails for most misdemeanors and nonviolent offenses.

node.title: Photo Shows Brazen Bay Area Smash-And-Grab of Car With Visiting Family, Toddlers Inside
node.description: "I was in the car when it happened. All I could hear was a smash...I jumped out of the car, but it was quick," a victim of the robbery said.

node.title: Concern over Covid-19 vaccine for children: 'Protective instinct kicks in'
node.description: More than a quarter of parents are reluctant or unsure about vaccinating children aged five to 11 against Covid-19, according to a new survey.

node.title: Letitia James suspends campaign for New York governor
node.description: "I have come to the conclusion that I must continue my work as attorney general," James said in a statement.

node.title: MacKenzie Scott says she won't disclose how much she donated
node.description: Scott, who is worth $59 billion, said she wants the focus to be on the charities rather than the size of her donations.

node.title: Medical illustrator depicts Black patients in drawings
node.description: Chidiebere Ibe, who is from Nigeria, began drawing medical illustrations​ – such as a fetus in a womb, lung conditions and eczema – of patients who are Black.

node.title: Democrats’ Dangerous Appetite for Eating Their Own
node.description: The party’s infighting and pessimism are just what Republicans savor.

node.title: Drug Company Settles with N.Y. for $200 Million in Sprawling Opioid Case
node.description: The agreement with Allergan, a company whose best-known product is Botox, is the latest settlement in the case jointly argued by New York State and two counties.

node.title: Josh Duggar Is Convicted of Downloading Child Sexual Abuse Imagery
node.description: Mr. Duggar, who gained celebrity on the TLC reality show “19 Kids and Counting,” faces a maximum penalty of 40 years in prison and $500,000 in fines.

node.title: Beautiful Photos Show Comet Leonard Passing Earth Before It Vanishes for 80,000 Years
node.description: The comet has been spotted flying through the night this month after it was discovered in January 2021.

node.title: IOC President Thomas Bach Says Media Should 'Respect' Peng Shuai's Wish for Privacy
node.description: "Why don't you respect Peng Shuai in this and let her decide where her priorities are," President of the International Olympic Committee Thomas Bach said.

node.title: 22 Journalists Killed in Philippines Since Rodrigo Duterte Became President
node.description: Jesus "Jess" Malabanan, 58, died after being shot in the head in the city of Calbayog in Samar province, as he watched television in his family stall.

node.title: 30-Year-Old With COVID Loses Arms, Legs After Being Given Choice to Amputate Limbs or Die
node.description: Candice Davis is now encouraging people to get vaccinated against the disease.

node.title: California Requiring Residents to Recycle Food Waste, Plans to Convert Into Energy Source
node.description: The state passed a law mandating Californians to put their food waste in a separate bin so it can be composted or turned into biogas, an energy source.

node.title: Letitia James Suspends NY Governor Bid to 'Finish Important Investigations' as AG
node.description: Instead, James announced she will run for re-election as New York attorney general in 2023.

node.title: FDA Authorizes Pfizer Booster Shots for 16- and 17-Year-Olds, CDC Will Have Final Say
node.description: This potential advancement comes as 5 million children ages 5 to 11 are expected to be at least partially vaccinated by the end of the week.

node.title: Arizona Coyotes Days Away from Eviction at Home Arena Over $1.3M in Unpaid Bills
node.description: The hockey team owes $1.3 million from "unfortunate human error" to the city of Glendale and the arena's management company.

node.title: Lawyer in Oxford Shooting Lawsuit Says School Officials Could Have Prevented 'Slaughter'
node.description: An attorney for survivors of the recent shooting said school administrators and teachers violated students' civil rights by not protecting them.
